content.description: Triangle Love starts at the first move of Toe Hook Traverse. Use the well-chalked mini arch to pull yourself up and stand in, to make your first big move straight up to a two knuckle ledge.Once you are standing; traverse right to the 4 finger pocket, and continue to the large three knuckle deep ledge. Here you will find the meaning of Triangle Love, as you cling to the small triangle nub on the ledge, and throw some large moves to get to the deep pocket about 5 feet straight to the right.That stretch is definitely the Crux.
content.location: The problem is located at the start of Toe Hook Traverse.It moves up to ledge and traverses right.You can traverse all the way to the right on big sandy hueco holds to the ground. Or drop after the crux.

content.description: Sits next to Main Traverse and goes all the way around this formation. Very fun moves. Variety of options.
content.location: Just west of the loop parking lot.

content.description:
Walk up and build your own anchor. Long long long slings are needed.

Start on typical traverse holds. Move up the series of huecos into a beautiful slab finish.

Hoping to bolt this soon.
content.protection: Build your own anchor up top. Slings and rope are needed because the best anchor positions are about 20 feet from the ledge.
content.location: Toehook area. In the center of the main traverse.

content.description: Super awesome overhang on sweet holds.  Start low on chalked up holds and mover right and under roof.  Has a spicy landing under the roof.
content.location: It's a 1 minute walk north of toe hook.  Walk past the toe hook and follow the wash.

content.description: This is a fun boulder problem that has a total of about 6 moves, but that are all big and unique. It has a very reach dependent crux. You will see two shallow pockets one on top of another,and a great right handed side pull. Up and to the right is a  horizontal three finger pocket.The crux is here at the three finger pocket.You remove one finger at a time to replace your right hand with your left; which allows you to make the big move out to the right to the final hold.
content.protection: Use a crash pad, watch out for the goat-heads.
content.location: This boulder problem starts towards the end of toe hook traverse as you move east to west.It starts about 6 feet to the left of the big heel hook move around the toe hook traverse bend.To get down, it is not a bad drop down to the crash pad from the final hold. (Maybe 6 feet)

content.description: Many variations to this fun traverse. Right to left or vice versa. High or low, etc. Don't know its rating. Will leave as V0 for now.
content.location: Just around the bend on the trails that head west from the loop parking lot.
